0.title: 2021 Phi Beta Kappa Scholarship Application Form
0.description:
In keeping with the goals of the Phi Beta Kappa Society, scholarships from WSU’s Gamma Chapter are intended
to “recognize and foster excellence in liberal learning at the undergraduate level.” The scholarship covers full
resident/in-state tuition and mandatory fees for academic year 2021-22. Applications are due April 1, 2021.

fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this nomination form so we can help you.

fields.descriptionPlaceholder: Enter consent agreement text here.  The Consent Field will store this agreement text with the form entry in order to track what the user has consented to.
fields.description: As part of the selection process, the Scholarship Committee needs to review an official copy of your transcript(s). Accordingly, do you give your consent to the Scholarship Committee to contact the WSU Registrar's Office and access your official transcript(s)?

fields.label: Form reminders: Personal Statement
fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this nomination form so we can help you.

fields.label: Instructions for Uploading Applicant Statement
fields.content:
Please use the upload field below to provide a personal statement about you and your education. It is to be no longer than two pages and double-spaced. It must address the following three points:

  1. Phi Beta Kappa stands for freedom of inquiry and expression, disciplinary rigor, breadth of intellectual perspective, the cultivation of skills of deliberation and ethical reflection, the pursuit of wisdom, and the application of the fruits of scholarship and research in practical life. What is the value of a liberal education that fosters these ideals?
  2. In what way(s) is your education preparing you for a career?
  3. How have you financed your education to this point?

fields.label: Applicant Statement Progress Indicator

fields.label: Form reminders: About Letters of Support
fields.content: Note: Required fields are marked by a red asterisk symbol (*) and faint red highlighting. Please contact our web coordinator if you encounter any problems with this nomination form so we can help you.

fields.label: Instructions for Letters of Support Section
fields.content: Please provide contact details for three faculty members or others that will separately provide letters of recommendation for you as a scholarship applicant. Once you submit this application form, these people will be contacted via an automated notification email that will provide instructions for submitting their letters of recommendation.

confirmations.name: Default Confirmation
confirmations.message:
Needs to be rewritten! So do email notifications.

Application Submitted

We have received your application for a Richard G. Law Excellence Award for Undergraduate Teaching for 2021. We have included a copy of your submission below with links to your uploaded documents. Notifications regarding Law Awards will be emailed to applicants by mid April. If you have any questions, please contact our web coordinator who will either provide assistance or route your inquiry to the Law Award Committee.

Copy of Your Submission

{all_fields}

notifications.name: Applicant notification of submission
notifications.subject: Your application for a Phi Beta Kappa Scholarship has been received
notifications.message:
Dear {Nominee name (First):1.3},

We are delighted to have received your application for a Phi Beta Kappa Scholarship for the 2021-22 academic year.

In keeping with the goals of the Phi Beta Kappa Society, scholarships from WSU’s Gamma Chapter are intended to “recognize and foster excellence in liberal learning at the undergraduate level.” The scholarship covers full resident/in-state tuition and mandatory fees for academic year 2020-21.

Notifications regarding Law Awards will be emailed to applicants by mid-April.

Sincerely,

Members of the Phi Beta Kappa Scholarship Selection Committee

Copy of your submission:

{all_fields}

notifications.name: Request for Letter of Support - 1
notifications.subject: Letter needed to support {Nominee name (First):1.3} {Nominee name (Last):1.6} for a Law award application
notifications.message:
Dear {Letter Writer 1 Name (First):33.3},

Each year, WSU faculty who provide outstanding teaching are eligible to apply for the Richard G. Law Excellence Award for Undergraduate Teaching. You were listed in a recent application submitted by {Nominee name (First):1.3} {Nominee name (Last):1.6} as someone who can provide a letter supporting their consideration for a Law award. In total, 2-3 such letters are required to complete the application process by the deadline of April 1, 2021.

We thank you for providing this letter of support. To help you with this worthy endeavor, we encourage you to explore the Law Award’s selection criteria and other details provided on the DAESA website. In your letter of support and to ease process of reviewing award candidates, please include the applicant’s name and mention the Law Award in the subject line of your letter.

When you have finished preparing your letter, please submit it by April 1 using a short online form we have provided on the DAESA website for collecting support letters. After completing the form, you will receive an email to let you know that your submission of the letter was successful.

Sincerely,

Members of the Law Award Committee

notifications.subject: Letter needed to support {Nominee name (First):1.3} {Nominee name (Last):1.6} for a Law award application
